website_summaries.verdict: Superior to hinged infusers, this is a very versatile infuser and is durable and well-designed.
pros: This large infuser is ideal for large batches and those who like stronger tea
Users report that it is easy to open and clean, and it is versatile enough to be used for tea, coffee, and mulled cider
cons: A few experienced issues with the lid staying closed, and some weren't happy with the larger size
Those who want single cups or milder tea might prefer the Apace or Krierah models

customer_reviews.title: Amazing quality

customer_reviews.title: Awesomesauce

customer_reviews.title: It is for life
customer_reviews.text: It is capsule infuser for tea; however, it is "spice cooking filter" for me when cooking best Vietnamese noodle soup - Phở . customer_reviews.title: BIG infuser makes a lot of tea!
customer_reviews.text: Perfect for making a big batch of tea in my Instant Pot. I heat the water up to a boil on 'sautée mode' and check the temperature with a thermometer for the kind of tea I'm going to brew. Once at the right temp, I switch my Instant Pot to 'keep warm' and plop in my tea-filled infuser for the time needed per type of tea and cover with a glass lid. Once the tea is properly steeped I pour the tea into a thermal carafe or a teapot. Very sturdy and well made. Hand washes easily and I use a toothbrush to get out any tea leaves that stick in some of the perforations. A+++
customer_reviews.author: A. Cheffy ⭐💖🌛Top Contributor: Cooking

customer_reviews.title: Perfect for brewing and straining big batches of loose bulk tea in one step.
customer_reviews.text: I bought this for brewing kombucha batches where I use 2T at a time of bulk loose tea. It is perfect, and fits perfectly in my French press to make 4 c of kombucha tea without any small particles floating away. The lid fits very securely, and it strains out the tea very easily when I finish brewing. When I used just the press I still had a lot of bits of tea, and this completely solved the issue. The chain and clip are also sturdy. This is probably the last infuser I’ll ever buy.
customer_reviews.author: Mumsers

customer_reviews.title: Large Capacity, Easy To Use, Only One Flaw
customer_reviews.text: I was somewhat dismayed upon initial inspection there is no detent to keep the top closed completely, rather it relies on friction. Worked well many times, but all it takes is once for the thermal expansion of the stainless to affect the friction and the top is off and tea is everywhere. Make that one fix and this is perfect. Works very well in my 800ml mug, allowing tea to fully infuse, because when your tea has fully expanded and fills the infuser to capacity you are not getting the most of your tea. It's a far cry from lame little tea balls I've used in the past.
customer_reviews.author: Richard J. Adams

customer_reviews.title: so i'm happy with it
customer_reviews.text: it fits a little more than 5 tbsp (.33cup/75ml) of loose tea, which then expands to fill it. i make 2qt of tea about every other day--this holds enough tea for about 1.25 qt/1.5L (steeped 3-5 minutes). it does what it says it can do, so i'm happy with it. for a sense of size, if you've seen a slinky (the metal kind, and not the little baby size, but the size bigger than that; i don't know if there are like, giant slinkys [slinkies?]), the cup part of the strainer can fit one in it, and it's almost flush to the sides and has a little room at the top. you could easily close it with the slinky in.
